sourcesContent:
const Text = [ { id: 'blah', text:

"NOT STUFF ABOUT ME"

, }, { id: 'about', text: (

{`Hello names Edgar I am a web dev and software enthuist who at first hated but now enjoys programming. That being said I am a avid bicyclist and although I havent worked out recently I do like excercise (see my hobbies section). I am an army reservist having been a war history buff for many years (and wanting to have some excuse for a good workout).`}

), }, { id: 'Fun', text: (

Since I am writing this in the winter, I am less enthusiastic about cycling currently mainly because the weather does not agree. That being said once the weather gets better I am sure I will be cycling once again. I have been a bicyclist all my life, I am used to biking long distances as I will explain below. Bicycling can be used as a combination of excercise, meditation, sight seeing, and transportation and I rate my experience in that order. It is a good excuse to go outside especially if you have one of those days where you arent doing anything. Overall you get to explore the city on your own terms be on the road, sidewalk, alleyway or even through a nice trail.

), }, { id: 'Niagra', text: (

I have biked to Niagra Falls from Toronto on multiple occasions (5 times). The first time around was the most taxing but it was just a matter of willpower moreso than any physical endurance (though it did require some). The trail I took was the Lakes Waterfront Trail as it ran through the city of Toronto all the way to the falls. Biking through Oakville and other communties like Burlington was a treat but the best part is definitely cycling through the country side where it was filled with open fields as far as the eye can see. Lots of good fruits too from the farmers out there. It almost became a ritual, as there was back to back trips every subsequent summer from I believe 2014. Theres a map on the side to show you the route taken.

), }, { id: 'Georgian Bay', text: (

So biking to Georgian Bay was a tale of tedium and tenacity. The overall trip was not entirely pleasant it was filled with episodes of extreme fatigue and biking through extreme heat in the day to extreme cold in the pitch darkness. The route we took is shown on the left but suffice to say it was a grueling journey with many days of unremarkable progress through mostly flat terrain and small towns though at times we did stop by many provincial parks where we busted out our hammock tents to sleep I can speak volumes on the entire trip if you would like to know more I will be making a seperate article/webpage talking more about this.

), }, { id: 'Warhammer Intro', text: (

i am a fan of Warhammer 40k but will make a seperate page for it in the future as I will speak volumes about it :D.

), }, ]; export default Text;
